title: Pick Order?
body: Who came up with this pick order crap? I mean why leave it up to chance. A random draw when you are playing ranked matches! That makes no sense! I mean is that for real or not?

replies.body: It makes perfect sense, how does it not? The only fair way to make sure everyone doesn't always get first or last pick is to make it random.

You could just call out what you want. That would be the fair way to do it. But forcing people into roles based on a random draw is dumb. Like for instance, If I was forced to be an adc. I have no interest in ADC or Marksman. It's boring and it's just not for be. SO, why ruin a game because someone happens to be first and someone else happens to be last?

You can always dodge the match if you're forced into an uncomfortable role. It's not a crime. You should just not overdo it. Leaving the champion select gives you a short time out penalty in addition with a small amount of LP loss in ranked (3 if you dodge occasionally 10 if you do it frequently). The LP loss scares off most people, but unless you're nearly at your "dream ranking" (the ranking that you've been trying to achieve for so long and need a lucky winning spree to achieve because it's above your level), LP doesn't mean SH*T. Your ranking is purely based on your hidden MMR (which doesn't get a penalty). LP will always follow MMR with a lag. If your MMR is platinum level and you are bronze V, you'll climb to platinum if you get a 50% winrate for a bunch of matches.

The pick order rule is only to settle disputes.

The proper way to determine who plays which role is still to *communicate and cooperate with your team*.

If you are not good at playing Marksman or don't wish to play it, then ask not to be given that role.  If your teammates are decent, then they will try to build a team around the strengths and weaknesses of the team members.
If they don't do that, then the chances are that they aren't very good at teamplay and you probably wouldn't do well in the game anyway.
